title: How to Run A Webserver From Your Computer

steps.headline: Find your web server computer.
steps.description: The computer should be able to store a lot of information. The processor is not very important. If you have a router, the computer should be directly connected to that router and not wireless to minimize server downtime.

steps.headline: Get a good web server program.
steps.description: The program runs the web server so it is very important. If possible, find a program that can run in the background without making your computer unusable. One of the more popular web servers is Apache.

steps.headline: Configure the web server.
steps.description: Normally the web server program has a guide on how to do this.

steps.headline: Create a basic main page to test the server.
steps.description: Make sure that you put this file in your web server's document path and name it as one of the index files.

steps.headline: Check that you can see the website from http://127.0.0.1/.
steps.description: If you see the site continue to the next step. If your server does not run on port 80 then test your site on http://127.0.0.1:portnumber/. You may need to reconfigure your web server if you can't see this site at all.

steps.headline: Get a friend to test your site on http://yourWANip/.
steps.description: If he/she sees the site then continue on. If not, check some of the tips.

steps.headline: Purchase a domain and set it to your WAN ip.
steps.description: If you have a dynamic ip, make sure that the domain registrar has dynamic DNS services.

steps.headline: Make your site.
steps.description: If you want to use server-side scripting you will need to install those applications and configure them in your server.
